name: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add spaghetti and cook according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, cut guanciale into small cubes. Cook in a large skillet over medium heat until crispy. Remove guanciale, leaving rendered fat in the pan.
In a bowl, whisk eggs with grated Pecorino Romano and a generous amount of black pepper until well combined.
Drain pasta, reserving about 1 cup of pasta water. Add hot pasta directly to the skillet with the guanciale fat.

Quickly pour the egg mixture over the pasta, tossing vigorously to coat. Add a splash of reserved pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce (the heat of the pasta will cook the eggs without scrambling them).
Stir in the crispy guanciale. Serve immediately with extra Pecorino and black pepper.

name: Quick Chicken Stir-Fry
instructions: In a bowl, marinate chicken slices with soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and cornstarch for 10 minutes.
Heat 1 tbsp vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat. Add chicken and stir-fry until cooked through and lightly browned. Remove chicken and set aside.
Add remaining 1 tbsp vegetable oil to the wok. Add bell pepper, broccoli, and carrots. Stir-fry for 3-5 minutes until crisp-tender.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger. Stir-fry for 1 minute until fragrant.
Return chicken to the wok. Toss everything together to combine. Serve immediately over cooked rice.

name: Simple Tomato Basil Pasta
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions in salted water until al dente. Drain, reserving about half a cup of pasta water.
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add sliced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant, being careful not to burn it.
Pour in the crushed tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens slightly.
Add the cooked pasta to the skillet with the tomato sauce. Toss to coat. If the sauce is too thick, add a little reserved pasta water until it reaches your desired consistency.
Stir in the fresh chopped basil. Serve hot, topped with Parmesan cheese if desired.

name: Creamy Mushroom Risotto
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Heat olive oil and butter in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add Arborio rice and stir for 1-2 minutes until translucent.
Pour in white wine and stir until completely absorbed.
Add hot broth one ladleful at a time, stirring constantly and waiting until each ladleful is absorbed before adding the next. This will take about 20-25 minutes.
In a separate small pan, quickly sauté the sliced mushrooms until tender. Add them to the risotto during the last 5 minutes of cooking.
Once rice is creamy and al dente, remove from heat. Stir in Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately, garnished with fresh parsley.

name: Homemade Guacamole
instructions: Halve and pit the avocados. Scoop the flesh into a medium bowl.
Mash the avocados with a fork until desired consistency (chunky or smooth).
Stir in diced red onion, minced jalapeños (if using), chopped cilantro, lime juice, salt, and cumin (if using).
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.
Serve immediately with tortilla chips or as a topping for tacos/burritos.

name: Simple Garden Salad
instructions: Wash and dry all vegetables thoroughly.
In a large salad bowl, combine mixed greens, cucumber, bell pepper, cherry tomatoes, and red onion.
Just before serving, drizzle with your favorite dressing and toss gently to coat.
Serve immediately as a side or add protein for a main meal.

name: Classic Pancakes
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, egg, and melted butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. A few lumps are okay.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium heat.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter per pancake onto the hot griddle.
Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and bubbles appear on the surface.
Serve hot with your favorite toppings like syrup, fruit, or whipped cream.

name: Oven-Roasted Salmon
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Pat salmon fillets dry with paper towels. Place them on the prepared baking sheet.
Drizzle olive oil over the salmon. Season generously with salt and pepper.
Top each fillet with a few lemon slices and a sprinkle of fresh dill (if using).
Roast for 12-15 minutes, or until salmon flakes easily with a fork.
Serve hot with a side of vegetables or rice.

name: Vegetable Curry
ingredients: Cooked rice or naan, for serving
instructions: Heat coconut oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in curry powder and cook for another minute.
Pour in coconut milk and diced tomatoes. Bring to a simmer.
Add sweet potato, cauliflower, and green beans. Stir well.
Cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until vegetables are tender. Add a splash of vegetable broth if the curry becomes too thick.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot over rice or with naan bread, garnished with fresh cilantro.

name: Berry Smoothie Bowl
ingredients: 1/2 cup unsweetened almond milk (or other milk)
Toppings: fresh berries, granola, coconut flakes
instructions: Combine frozen berries, frozen banana, almond milk, and chia seeds (if using) in a high-speed blender.
Blend until smooth and creamy, adding more milk if needed to reach desired consistency.
Pour into a bowl and arrange your favorite toppings on top.
Serve immediately.

name: Beef Tacos
ingredients: Toppings: shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheese, sour cream, salsa
instructions: Brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Drain excess fat.
Stir in taco seasoning and water. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until liquid has evaporated and beef is well coated.
Warm taco shells or tortillas according to package directions.
Assemble tacos by filling shells/tortillas with seasoned beef and your favorite toppings.
Serve hot.

name: Broccoli Cheddar Soup
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in broth and add broccoli florets. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until broccoli is tender.
Using an immersion blender, blend the soup to your desired consistency (chunky or smooth). Alternatively, carefully transfer portions to a regular blender.
Stir in milk and shredded cheddar cheese until cheese is melted and soup is creamy.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

name: Spinach and Feta Omelette
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a bowl, whisk eggs with milk (if using), salt, and pepper until well combined.
Heat olive oil or butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Add spinach and cook until wilted, about 1-2 minutes. Spread evenly in the pan.
Pour egg mixture over the spinach.
As the edges set, gently push the cooked egg towards the center, tilting the pan to allow uncooked egg to flow underneath.
When the omelette is mostly set but still slightly moist on top, sprinkle feta cheese over one half.
Fold the omelette in half and cook for another 30 seconds to 1 minute, or until cheese is slightly melted.
Serve immediately.

name: Lentil Soup
ingredients: 1 cup brown or green lentils, rinsed
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion, carrots, and celery. Cook until softened, about 8-10 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in rinsed lentils, vegetable broth, crushed tomatoes, dried thyme, and bay leaf. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until lentils are tender.
Remove bay leaf. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, cream together softened butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla extract.
In a separate medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheets.
Bake for 9-12 minutes, or until edges are golden brown and centers are still soft.
Let cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
